meanings.definition: A type of monkey found in Asia and Africa.
meanings.sent1: The macaque swung from tree to tree in the jungle.
meanings.sent2: I saw a macaque at the zoo during my visit.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous macaque stole a tourist's hat and ran off!
meanings.sent4: Her laughter echoed through the forest like the calls of a macaque.
meanings.sent5: The colorful fur of the macaque shimmered in the sunlight.

meanings.definition: A small to medium-sized primate with a short tail and cheek pouches.
meanings.sent1: The macaque carefully stored nuts in its cheek pouches.
meanings.sent2: The baby macaque clung to its mother as they moved through the trees.
meanings.sent3: The macaque looked like it was playing hide-and-seek with its tail!
meanings.sent4: Her eyes sparkled mischievously, much like a curious macaque's.
meanings.sent5: The agility of the macaque amazed the onlookers at the sanctuary.

meanings.definition: Any of various Old World monkeys of the genus Macaca.
meanings.sent1: The macaque species in the zoo were well cared for by the staff.
meanings.sent2: Researchers studied the behavior of the macaque to learn more about primates.
meanings.sent3: The macaque seemed to be the leader of the monkey troop, sitting proudly.
meanings.sent4: Her family tree was as diverse as a group of macaques in the wild.
meanings.sent5: The intelligence of the macaque was evident in its problem-solving skills.
